channel.title: $1600 build
channel.description:
From msy.com.au
CPU E8500 $303
CASE Antec 300 $108
PSU Antec NeoPower 550W $121
MEMORY 2G-800 kingston x2 (36) $72
HHD WD sata 160G x 2 (57) $114
512M 9800GT Asus $196
MOBO Asus P5QL-SE $149
DVD sata pioneer 216 x2 (31) $62
Labour $70
OS OEM VHP 64bit $183
MONITOR 20” 5ms DVI WS Samsung 2033SW $213
- $1591
Thoughts? Suggested improvements before I buy it?

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:

quad core! intel i7

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:15, topic:264304”][quote author=RXVL link=topic=349040.msg2688925#msg2688925 date=1235850797]
Corsair > Kingston
[/quote]

They are both good brands, they are probably made in the same factory anyway.[/quote]Corsair is more of a premium brand, Kingston to me is a cheap low quality brand (only because they sell this brand of RAM at my local IT store, which is the worst IT store in the world)

They are both good brands, they are probably made in the same factory anyway.

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Original Daniel, post:12, topic:264304”]I thought about using partitions, but I’m trying to make it as idiot proof as possible. (I won’t be there to do it) Plus the tax payer pays for half the computer so the extra money isn’t a big deal.

I would build it, (I built the computer I have now) but if something goes wrong a year from now my mum can bitch at msy instead of me.

Looked more into vista and decided against it, I’ll just put on a copy of XP.

Sales for vista are bad, microsoft were forced to keep selling xp etc, so I agree it should be fine for another couple years before they get windows 7.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

I thought about using partitions, but I’m trying to make it as idiot proof as possible. (I won’t be there to do it) Plus the government pays for half the computer so the extra money isn’t a big deal.

I would build it, (I built the computer I have now) but if something goes wrong a year from now my mum can bitch at msy instead of me.

Looked more into vista and decided against it, I’ll just put on a copy of XP.

Sales for vista are bad, microsoft were forced to keep selling xp etc, so I agree it should be fine for another couple years before they get windows 7.

Read full topic

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Yeah, XP will still go strong for a couple more years.

Read full topic

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

Original Daniel:

What’s wrong with vista home premium? The service pack 2 will be out soon and XP will be obsolete in a few years.

No. Vista will be obsolete by the end of this year.
XP was already meant to be obsolete however because Vista is so crappy, and in my opinion XP works happily for me, what reason do i or other users have to change?
Windows 7 is out sometime soon this year, it’s to replace Vista.

Read full topic

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

I assume hes australian, as it’s an australian website, the build is good except you really don’t need the operating system, save ur self 200$ and download a cracked one.

with the hard drive, 160x2 is (stupid) imo, for 110$ you will easily be able to get a 500 or 640gig and just use 2 partitions to separate data. C:/ for windows/apps etc, D for games etc.

Read full topic

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

If it was me, I’d swap the Antec 300 for 900, and drop vista and build it myself.

$70 For 2-3 hours work doesn’t seem worth it at all.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @Andrew Andrew
item.description:
@Andrew wrote:

Buy one sata hdd, and its like 150$ for a TB external hardrive. Way more worth it. I would suggest a cheaper monitor to save money

Read full topic

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Original Daniel:

I want 2 hard drives, one for files and the other for software. That way the one with software can be regularly formatted.

could just use partitions…

Read full topic

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

You can download a precracked vista ultimate. You install normally, it never asks you to activate. I’d say it is actually more user friendly than one that you have to activate.

Read full topic

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

I want 2 hard drives, one for files and the other for software. That way the one with software can be regularly formatted.

I got an expensive PSU because the better ones pay for themselves in power consumption, + are less likely to spike and damage the other parts.

What’s wrong with vista home premium? The service pack 2 will be out soon and XP will be obsolete in a few years.

The main reason why I’m not pirating the os is because the computer is for my mum and brother, not me. I’m moving and won’t be around to solve any problems so I want it as user friendly as possible.

Read full topic

item.title: $1600 build
item.dc:creator: @boriz boriz
item.description:
@boriz wrote:

HD seems a bit too expensive. I’d just get 1TB for $120 like me.

Why do you need two dvd drives?
Also, power supply is WAYYY overpriced. I got an OCZ 700W for 60 bucks…
My first modular PSU was 70 bucks, ULTRA 500W.

l2 be a pirate, and what the hell is vhp?

EDIT: vista home premium,
It sucks.

Read full topic
